results.title: Pintubi
results.brief_description: The Pintubi tribe of the Northern Territory still live nomadically by hunting and gathering, and have little contact with white Australians. The film shows how the Administration is attempting to help them. Music composed and played by Don Burrows, narration by James Dibble.

results.title: Pins and needles
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky, Kim Batterham, Genni Batterham and Documentary Films
results.brief_description: An account of the emotional struggle of a 24 year old woman, Genni Batterham, who contracts Multiple Sclerosis and becomes a paraplegic in less than 18 months. The film examines the attitude and reactions of her parents, husband and society.

results.title: Pinocchio (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Hamilton Luske, Ben Sharpsteen, Walt Disney, RKO Radio Pictures and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: This inspiring tale about the magical powers of believing in your dreams is a timeless fantasy that has delighted generations. Winner of two Academy Awards for Best Score and Song, Jiminy Cricket’s “When you wish upon a star.” While kindy toymaker Gepetto sleeps, a blue fairy brings his beloved marionette Pinocchio to life. With the help of his wise friend Jiminy Cricket, Pinocchio begins a voyage that will test his loyalty, bravery and honesty- virtues he must learn to become a real boy. Features the voices of Mel Blanc, Don Brodie, Walter Catlett, Cliff Edwards and others.

results.title: Pinocchio
results.brief_description: This famous story of the mischievous marionette and his long-suffering ‘father’ Gepetto, is full of fantastic adventure brought about by Pinocchio’s genius for landing himself in trouble and his naive trust in Mr. Cat and Mr. Fox. This production is rich in special effects and incorporates original music and songs. Pinocchio appears for the first time as a real live puppet moving without strings. Based on the novel by Carlo Collodi.

results.title: Pink triangles
results.brief_description: Examines discrimination against lesbians and gay men, challenging some of society’s attitudes towards homosexuality in the process. Also looks at historical patterns of racial, religious, political and sexual persecution. Historical photographs, prints, engravings and archival film, including footage from Nazi Germany and the 1954 McCarthy trials, have been incorporated in this powerful documentary. During the middle ages pink triangles represented ‘victim’ resurfacing in Nazi Germany concentration camps to identify homosexuals before being reclaimed by gay activists towards the end of the 20th century as a positive symbol to represent their struggle.

results.title: Pink narcissus
results.brief_description: In this imaginatively erotic surrealist film a young man (Bobby Kendall) escapes the confines of the real world through the personas of a slave, bullfighter, wood nymph and harem boy; all shot in a glorious sequence of pink hued fantasies. One of the most infamous gay films produced, it played to a sold out crowd at the 1984 New York Gay Film Festival. Shot on 8mm by Anonymous (James Bidgood has been credited as director since 1984), the final edit of this video was completed by Martin Jay Sadoff who included the musical track and sound effects.

results.title: Pink Floyd: Pulse
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Lana Topham, Pink Floyd (1987) Ltd and Picture Music International (PMI)
results.brief_description: Recorded live at Earls Court, London on October 20th, 1994. This is classic Pink Floyd performing some of their best known music including “Learning to fly”, “Another brick in the wall”, “Money”, “Us and them”, and “Comfortably numb”. Features David Gilmour, Nick Mason and Richard Wright with Sam Brown, Claudia Fontaine, Durga McBroom on backing vocals, Jon Carin on keyboard and vocals, Dick Parry on saxophone, Tim Renwick on guitars and vocals and Gary Wallis on percussion.

results.title: Pink Floyd - The Wall
results.creator_credit: Gerald Scarfe, Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Tin Blue
results.brief_description: Pink Floyd’s landmark album was translated into an original rock music motion picture experience. Bob Geldof plays Pink, a burnt out rock superstar who thinks he is going mad inside a room at a Los Angeles hotel. The film takes us on a downward spiral into Pink’s hell. Live action is intercut with brilliant animation by Gerald Scarfe and the soundtrack by Pink Floyd has given this film its cult status.

results.title: Pingu: Pingu and his friends
results.creator_credit: PINGU B V NL and Pingu Filmstudio
results.brief_description: Pingu and his family and friends invite you to join them in ten of their stories of fun and games. Stories on the tape include: ‘Pingu plays ice hockey’; ‘Pingu and Pinga don’t want to go to bed’; ‘Pingu on the makeshift skis’; ‘Pingu runs away from home’; ‘Pingu builds an igloo’; ‘Pingu has music lessons from his grandfather’; ‘Pingu in the ice cave’; ‘Pingu’s tobogganing’; ‘Pingu’s grandfather is sick’; ‘Pingu at school’.
